items.message: Areas most at risk include low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. Weather conditions have improved today but further rainfall is forecast from tomorrow Thursday 04/12/25. River levels are falling slightly but will remain high and are likely to rise again in response to the forecast rainfall later this week and into the weekend.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
High tides this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 19:45 on 03/12/2025. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers or on the coast.
Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the evening of the 03 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible tonight, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is mostly dry overnight, with further rain expected tomorrow.  We expect river levels to fall slowly.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 11:00 04 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the evening of the 03 Dec 2025.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible today, 03 Dec 2025, along the River Thames, especially in the Kempsford area. This is as a result of rivers responding to recent rainfall. The weather forecast is mostly dry over night, with further rain expected tomorrow.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 11:00 04 Dec 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: River levels are still falling very gradually, but remain high at Sherborne Lake, above the Alert level. Further rain overnight tonight into Thursday morning, 04/12/2025, will keep this level high and will likely cause other local rivers to rise again, including the River Yeo, River Wriggle and River Cam. Flooding of low-lying land and roads is possible in this area, including around the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Therefore the need for this Alert remains. Further heavy rain is expected on Friday 05/12/2025 into Saturday. We are closely monitoring the situation, and checking defences, bridges, debris screens and culverts. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 13:00PM on 04/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels are falling slowly but remain high and the potential for flooding continues today, 3 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation . Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 4 December 2025 or as the situation changes

items.description: River Dikler from Condicote to Little Rissington
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message: This flood alert remains in place. Areas most at risk include low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed. items.message:
High river levels today and tomorrow may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible overnight from 03 December 2025.
 
Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers. The main areas of concern are Cullompton, Willand, Culmstock, Hemyock, Bradninch, Broadclyst and Clyst St Mary.
We expect river levels to respond to additional rainfall over the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall on Monday, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgeley. The Severn Ham, Tewkesbury may start to fill.  

Predicted peaks:-  
Mythe 3.1m to 3.7m 05/12/2025 PM. 
Haw Bridge 4.0m to 4.7m 05/12/2025 PM. 

Tides are increasing from Wednesday until the weekend. River levels at Sandhurst and Gloucester will be influenced by these tides. Current predictions: 

Sandhurst 2.9m to 3.1m 03/12/2025 PM and 3.0m to 3.2m 04/12/2025 AM.  
Gloucester 2.5m to 2.8m 03/12/2025 PM and 2.8m to 3.1m 04/12/2025 AM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   
This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 4 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.message: With dry weather today, river levels have fallen on most rivers in West Somerset, but remain high on the Washford River. Further rainfall overnight tonight and into tomorrow morning, Thursday 04/12/2025, will keep the Washford River at Alert level, and will cause the other rivers to rise again. There is a risk of flooding tomorrow, Thursday. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers including the Horner Water, Rivers Aller, Washford River and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. This message will be updated by 13:00PM on 04/12/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
River levels are due to remain high for the next few days.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Dee. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 16:00PM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall on Monday, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. 
Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains may affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St and Waterside Gates are closed at Upton upon Severn.   

Predicted peaks:- 
Bewdley 3.0m to 3.8 m 04/12/2025 PM. 
Worcester 3.4m to 4.1m 04/12/2025 OVERNIGHT. 
Diglis 3.0m to 3.7m 05/12/2025 AM. 
Kempsey Yacht Club 5.0m to 5.7m 05/12/25 AM. 
Saxons Lode 4.1m to 4.7m 05/12/25 PM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  Consider the installation of property flood resilience measures 

This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 4 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are currently rising due to rainfall on Monday, subsequently flooding may continue over the next few days. 
Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey.  

Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme may become operational from 03/12/2025 AM. 

Predicted peak:-  
Kempsey Yacht Club 5.0m to 5.7m 05/12/25 AM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   
This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 4 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. items.description: Minor Watercourses from Heighington to Dunston
items.message: High river levels on Wednesday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 3rd December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11:00am on Thursday, 4th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Holderness Drain at Wawne Common and Woody Carr

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, Kingston upon Hull

items.message: High river levels are expected to cause flooding today.  Flooding is expected today, Wednesday 03 December 2025. Properties most affected include areas around Wawne Common, Woody Carr and North's Bridge. We are closely monitoring the situation and have pumps in operation in the area. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9AM on 04 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Great Ouse from Thornborough to Newport Pagnell
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.
